text: In custom modules, how can I include a javascript file that I want to pull from HubSpot inside of the custom module HTML?
If I’m not mistaken, you need to include it in the JS section to be able to publish it to the marketplace
there is a "linked files" section in the DMv2 that you can add a linked file to, otherwise, as <@U4RP6AGV9> said, you can do it in the JS section
what would be the opposite of the *in* operator? {% if '/tag' in request.path %} i'd like to return something if /tag is NOT in the request path.
I’ve been using the new design manager tool for a bit but after some time, I’ve been getting a bunch of warning messages, especially in the loops. Any reason why this would happen?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
<@U7AU6414J> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U7AU6414J/FBB9Q9B1C/screen_shot_2018-06-19_at_3.19.33_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-06-19 at 3.19.33 PM.png>

Try simply removing the percents from the label

It shouldn’t be an issue but I could see it acting weird because of it. it’s an easy thing to remove and re-add so it’s worth checking

hmm, i have some content within the **Content Settings -> Site footer HTML** that isn't showing within my templates.
I thought this section was outputted as part of the `{{ standard_footer_includes }}` tag?
I assume you’re building a coded template?
